reviewText: and down right honest. Like all of anything with Billy Graham connected to it,honesty. Integrity,and love for God and His Word. I cried through much of it. The Holy Spirit worked through this long after the filming,which is what happens with "the truth" that God is involved in. Billy Graham as a mere man,will not once let you down. He is devoted to God and his family and saving souls before Jesus comes back. I literally was rooting for those who commented,that they would go up front and be saved. Good presentation.

reviewText: This was a good movie.  I found Rev. Graham's earlier life very interesting.  I wish it had gone further into his life.
Title: N/A

reviewText: PBS finally did a good job! It was honest, respectful and right in your face. I had given up on the Liberal PBS, but have to give credit were it's due. It is a brilliant, warm and inspiring work of art. However, how or what else could you do about this man. He simply stands alone.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I pulled the DVD out of the player halfway through this documentary.  Why?  Because PBS can't help working its secular, progressive rhetoric into everything.  PBS is anything but unbiased in its reporting.  The greatest evangelist this world has ever seen deserves a better presentation of accomplishments than this unauthorized "biography."  If you really wish to know Billy Graham better, I would suggest God's Ambassador, hosted by Sir David Frost.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The DVD outlines the evangelistic profile of this great man of God. Billy graham's messages are simple and predictable and yet with so much impact

reviewText: Basically this is a history, biography of Billy graham. It's good, but it does not show you a lot of his preaching in this video
